name: roastbeet
text: The Turks I know are midget-robots, drug dealers, and outsourcers.

name: nyu
text: Are you German?

name: mortshire
text: the world may never know.

name: roastbeet
text: Not German; I just know strange people. And midget-robots .

name: gazdatronik
text: this is the first strip that i realized that lyle had a mustache and is not just constantly smiling.

name: centipede_damascus
text: I don't know any Turks, but I know they live in Istanbul and not Constantinople.

name: suprememongoose
text: It's true!

name: closefriend
text: Oh, shit, I had a date in Constantinople!

name: centipede_damascus
text: She's waiting for you in Istanbul.

name: saint
text: just pray it's not one of those midget-robots, drug dealers, or outsourcers that roastbeef talked about.

name: em2
text: TMBG!

name: chloraloner
text: I left my heart in Constantinople.

name: honesttom
text: Well, that's really no one's business but theirs.

name: farqussus
text: What's the big deal? Old New York used to be New Amsterdam.

name: orvel
text: Why'd they change it?

name: tellumo
text: I certainly can't say. Perhaps people just liked it better that way.

name: waddlerz
text: Byzantium?

name: griffypoo
text: If you knew some, you could ask why Constantinople got the works.

name: bron
text: He's just saying what we're all feeling.

name: abe
text: I have said this to myself.

name: chaesar
text: Ahh, the quotable Lyle! The last panel could've been the whole comic, like a Family Circus (gag) and it'd still deserve a 5.

name: apocowarg
text: Family Circus is the AIDS virus of the sunday paper bloodstream.

name: red_dawn
text: A comment left by red_dawn was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Nurdbot, Sprog, sumisueme)

name: pascal
text: Yes.

name: nexus
text:
I think he meant sober as in personality, chums.

It's a nice play on words.

name: nexus
text: I have never known a Turk that wasn't sober in his personal life.

name: ralgnar
text: I suspect his meaning is based on the historical use of Turk as referring to a member of the Ottoman Empire, one of the major islamic kingdoms of the world from the high middle ages until just after world war one. As islamic sharia law forbids the drinking of alcohol, the empire, like many other islamic states, banned the practice, at least for the muslim majority. Hence the expression: Sober as a Turk.

name: centipede_damascus
text: You know too much.

name: senseihollywood
text: thank you Cliff Clayven

name: umbra
text: Norm!

name: a_dude
text: the age old question... why can't i wake up sauced?

name: kelsotimebomb
text: Indeed. One that we all must face.

name: u235
text: You're not drinking enough before you go to bed.

name: dracer2
text: Nobody can wake up sauced. People who say "I think I'm still drunk" in the morning are just chicks who are trying to play down the fact that last night WE TOTALLY GOT DRUNK, HAD SEX.

name: redjoker
text: meh i woke up drunk more times than i can count... which isnt saying much... but still... just drink 2 or 3  bottles of vodka and  you cant possibly  sleep long  enough to get sober...

name: ashbery
text:
Yeah, untrue. Waking up drunk is just like waking up hungover, but with more drinking.

Enjoy these, your salad days.

name: danjoebak
text: Now this is one of my classics. More of Lyle's alcoholic   take on life would be nice.

name: f1shst1ck
text: Are turks known specifically for their sober tendencies?

name: mashuren
text:
What's up with that clock? Is it some sort of 24-hour clock without a minute hand? If that's the case, then it's wrong.

That clock confuses me.

name: silver_lake
text: The significant hand of the clock is pointing to the 7-hour.

name: tellumo
text: I think it's exactly 7:37 or sometime around then, so the minute and hour hand are right over each other.

name: epicurus
text: I have thought this on at least three occasions and I think this is marketable.

name: tinhand
text:
Excellent There Might Be Giants reference there fellows.
Personally, I long to live such a lifestyle where the only responsibilities and problems seem to be related to getting drunk. He has no bills to pay, prison-time to serve or jobs to hunt for, apparently. Does he even pay for his gin? Only Onstad knows.
Then again it's an early strip. I recall Lyle looking for a job in a later strip.

name: spectre
text: Lyle's blog is almost all about work and getting money one way or another.

name: hawaiian_robot
text: And getting fired from various hospitality jobs, or starring in gonzo videos, or fucking post-op trannies.

name: philosophe
text: I have woken up still buzzed from the night before, drank a few cold ones, fell back asleep, and then woken up drunk. It's pretty good. I've also woken up early, dropped a couple acid tabs, set my alarm for 2 hours later, and woke up tripping. THAT was interesting.

name: tellumo
text: I know the "excellent icon-comment synergy, dude" comment is hella overplayed, but dude, excellent icon-comment synergy.

name: straw
text: This is how I feel most days.

name: greymantledwolf
text: my daily lament.

name: hyetal
text: Seven AM and sober as a Turk; ten AM and drunk as a lord.  What happens at one?

name: molesticide
text: you are not afraid of the motherfucking police.

name: jlynes
text: One PM, out like a light.

name: zebra
text: This was my first strip and the reason I like Lyle so much.

name: snowman
text: Classic.  I love that I actually feel sorry for Lyle's predicament here.  Masterful.

name: jjg
text: Simple solution, get an IV and fill it with Jack. Sorted

name: satellitetv
text: My head-of-department is a Turk, and is responsible for the dry campus with which I have struggled.

text: Replace "gin" with "lasagna" to make an odd but basically typical Garfield strip

text:
It's a window into humanty's own soul...

Oh wait, it's just a window.

name: zapatos
text: Potato, potato.

text: this is the first time i have noticed the manliness of the tigers stache

name: mc_white
text: I've asked myself the last line sooooo many times

name: cobra_lionfist
text: a poignant moment...

name: wite_rabit
text: This is the saddest thing.

name: wacks
text:
A shoe is an item of cscs exam footwear evolved at first to protect the human foot and later, additionally, as an item of decoration in itself. The foot contains more bones than any other single part of the body, and has evolved over hundreds of thousands of years in relation to vastly varied terrain and climatic conditions. Together with the proprioceptive system, it is cset exam what makes balance and ambulation possible.

Until recent years, shoes were not fcat exam worn by most of the world's population%u2014largely because they could not afford them. Only with the advent of mass production, making available for the first time the cheap flip-flop-type sandal, for example, has shoe-wearing ftce exam become predominant.
